website_summaries.verdict: Good alarm clock and radio unit, but the awesome thing is that it projects the time and/or temperature on your wall or ceiling. That's just downright convenient.
pros: Big display and it will project time and/or temperature on your wall or ceiling
Yes, it has a thermometer and a calendar
Good radio, alarm, and speaker, too
cons: Battery backup that keeps time and alarm settings only, but won't activate the alarm when power is out

website_summaries.verdict: This clock radio is a challenge to program, but includes so many features for the price that it may be worth the effort.
pros: Multiple options including dual alarm, sleep timer and indoor temperature reading
Good radio reception, even in rural areas
Time projection onto walls or ceiling is convenient
cons: Digital menus are difficult to navigate
Programming radio stations is problematic for some

customer_reviews.title: Cannot change projection
customer_reviews.text: I really like the clock a lot - It has numerous features as noted by many of the other commentators.. My only complaint is that you cannot adjust the projected image from vertical to horizontal as I could on my previous Oregon Scientific clock. My clock is on my dresser and it projects from top to bottom or head to feet I cannot change the image to read left to right. Note in the photo it is 4am. The 4 is at my feet and the 0 is at my head.
customer_reviews.author: Eddy

customer_reviews.title: Five stars, then 1 star
customer_reviews.text: I bought this clock one year and 30 days ago. During that time it has worked as expected. The LED display is bright, both on the unit and the projection, and the temperature readout is convenient. It held the time well. I used neither the radio nor the alarm. Yesterday it stopped working. It has not been dropped or knocked over or wet. We are not at a high elevation or subject to intense radiation. There is absolutely no reason for this clock to be dead except a problem with manufacture. This saddens me, as I have a second one, purchased a few months later, in another bedroom. Fail. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: C. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Piece of sh*T
customer_reviews.text: I'm a person that buys things based on it's longevity BUT this missed the marked in that realm. I purchased in 2015 and today the radio has officially stopped working. I used this radio to listen to while i'm getting ready in the mornings. It would cut off randomly on its own and I would have to stop what I'm doing to turn it off and back on again to get this thing working again. Now, that little trick does not work at all. The radio cuts back on for 5 seconds and goes out immediately. Don't waste your money if you want to use it for all its intended for and if you want something longterm. You're welcome :-)
customer_reviews.author: E. Elisa

customer_reviews.title: ITS BEEN SIMPLIFIED AND IMPROVED
customer_reviews.text: THE MAGNASONIC PROJECTION RADIO ALARM CLOCK HAS UNDERGONE QUITE A METAMORPHASIS. THE FUNCTIONS ARE EASIER TO UNDERSTAND AND THE BUTTONS ARE RELOCATED TO MAKE USING IT SIMPLER.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not really a clock, more of a time guesser
customer_reviews.text: The projection is nice and the controls are not that bad to learn, but... IT DOESN'T KEEP ACCURATE TIME. I know that is a lot to ask..... from a clock. It loses time like China loses Coronavirus statistics. Avoid this unless you want a clock that can confidently project a time estimate on your ceiling.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Eh...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this since November and used it like twice because I dunno what all these buttons do and I have to hold this one and tap that one and I want to go to bed but I can't because these buttons that I don't know what to do with. But hey... it's 74.3 degrees in here... I know that. so there's that, but who gives a frig about that? It's not like I asked a question. Stupid. I'll lower the rating tomorrow after I am late to work because I didn't press these buttons right to make the friggin thing go off.
customer_reviews.author: JohnHowardP

customer_reviews.title: There are many excellent features in this product
customer_reviews.text: I gave this product to a non profit women's shelter. They like the alarm clock feature and the radio especially but they also like the projection feature of the time so all the women could see the time. I think the price is good considering the many features. I recommend this product. John
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The set-up instructions are very clear and easy. The brightness display is vivid but doesn't keep me up at night (I'm not too sensitive a sleeper though). The laser time feature is super cool to me, but pretty pointless with the sun in the morning :/ I would need blackout curtains for it to actually be effective. It is interesting to see what times you wake up during the night though. The radio works well (and I live in a very old, cement and rebar building) and has a good volume range. It allows two alarm settings and is easy to set up for repeating on weekdays, once, weekends, every day, what have you. Good product overall.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: projection clock with bright display
customer_reviews.text: 12/18/2015 this clock is past the posted return date of October but it no longer projects the time. I definitely do NOT recommend buying it. The item is only 3 months old and no longer works as it is supposed to. It only projects the temperature and does not project the time which is what most of us want Here is website. . Great projection clock except the display is too bright at night. I gave this to my nephew. I would definitely have kept it if I could have dimmed the display. It is the perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: Phazie

customer_reviews.title: Radio died, otherwise pretty cool.
customer_reviews.text: Big sticker on the back says MADE APRIL 2016. Of course, January 1, 2018, it never went off. I woke up late and tried turning the radio on, but nothing. No sound at all. Pretty useless for an alarm clock, still pretty cool displaying the time on the ceiling from across the room. Sitting up to look at the clock always was a hassle... Still mad it didnt even make it two years. Call me old fashioned, but I refuse to let these Chinese manufacturers brainwash us into thinking products are meant to die after 12 months.
customer_reviews.author: Tigglebitties

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful design. Instantly switched to the correct time via the Atomic Clock.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot find anything negative to say about this wonderful alarm clock radio. The face of the clock is stunning due to the use of led dots that glow a mellow blue color. As soon as I plugged it in, the clock adjusted to the exact time via the Atomic Clock. It also gave an accurate reading for the room temperature which is always on display on the face of the clock. I wouldn't think twice ordering another as a gift for a family member. Oh, by the way, it also displays the Corona Virus world-wide total! Just kidding.
customer_reviews.author: JesusChrysler

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect....
customer_reviews.text: It's compact size is nice. The front display is nice and legible with adjustable brightness. The projection of the time is strong and quite clear on the ceiling. It is hard to program the alarms...it's easy to set the time portion, but to choose radio over buzzer is a bit confusing. The buttons don't respond as the instructions say they should. Setting the days of the weeks for particular alarms is also more complicated than the instructions lead you to believe. Basically satisfied with the purchase as the projection is great, and I don't have to wear glasses to see it. I love the fact you can rotate/ move the projection around to suit your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Good ceiling projection.  Terrible alarm clock.
customer_reviews.text: Get this if you want to project time on ceiling or want a low-light-easy-to-read display. It's a terrible alarm clock. *Pros* Casts good clear image to ceiling. Radio reception pretty good. Sound quality pretty good. Dimmer is easy to change & good brightness levels (really bright, very low, off). *Cons* Alarm clock is counter intuitive. I hate it. The config options for days of the week for alarm to go off are "1-1, 1-7, 6-7..." I can't remember what those mean. And there's 2 bell symbols for each of the 2 alarm options (so 4 bell symbols) with no hint at what those indicate. The alarm-turning-on-buttons are small and on the very back of the clock - difficult to reach.
customer_reviews.author: G. Millikan

customer_reviews.title: Nice clock
customer_reviews.text: I have had this clock for 5 years. I like the ceiling display feature. It has never set the correct time on it's own, I always have to set it for daylight savings. And it is always a couple minutes behind my phone time after a power outage. I then have to manually adjust the time. It is not difficult to do but I was disappointed 5 years ago. The radio is not loud at all, I can not hear it unless I am laying inches from it. I think it used to be louder. I never use the alarm, but it does still work. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: mother of three

customer_reviews.title: Great features, but speaker failed in ~3 yrs
customer_reviews.text: Bought in 2015, used daily, lots of nice features. Projection on ceiling was awesome, loved the room temp indicator, allowed for setting separate weekend and weekday alarms. Also had the correct time and date when I plugged it in and self corrected for daylight savings. In timekeeping it's slightly fast, and will crawl ahead of actual time over many months. The main reason I bought this was to be a safety net if my smartphone alarm didn't wake me up, and it worked great. Unfortunately the speaker died 6 months ago. So it lasted about 3 years. I'm tempted to just buy another but would like something that lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: b12

customer_reviews.title: Nice Set of features in one package
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an alarm clock to replace one that the buttons had worn out. I needed to have a set day alarm so I didn't have to futz with it on weekends to sleep in and I wanted to have it automatically set to the atomic clock so I didn't have to reset each time day light saving cut in/out. This was one of the few clocks that fit the bill. The only complaint is that it doesn't display the date in normal mode and the two dimmer settings are sort of bright and really bright. I just turn the display off at night and rely on the projection clock which is a nice feature
customer_reviews.author: DMac

customer_reviews.title: reliable and bright
customer_reviews.text: This alarm clock is very reliable and has kept my hisband from being late for work a couple of times already when his phone alarm didnt go off. It is not intuitive to set the alarms though so you have to spend about 10 minutes going through instructions, but once that is done it is fairly easy to deal with. The projection is only bright enough to be seen in a pretty dim room so that feature isn't useful for night shift workers unless they have black out curtains. Other than thst O have no complaints. I like the sleek look and easy on off switch for alarms.
customer_reviews.author: Mosspelt

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to set the alarm. Very unhappy
customer_reviews.text: This alarm clock is impossible to set. I gave this to my son who was a senior in high school, we both have difficulty setting it. He goes to school at different times everyday and it is a lot of work to set it. Alarm clocks should be simple and easy to set without having to read instructions every time. I got this for him at Christmas time and cannot return now. It is now in a box and we purchased a much easier one off of Amazon that sets up in two seconds. If you're looking to use this regularly as an alarm clock it's not a good choice for the setup is very very difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced and works great
customer_reviews.text: This item is exactly like described. I love the back light and how bright and readable the time is projected on the ceiling. I felt it was very reasonably price and superior to some of the other projection clocks I had. I bought this for my husband at Christmas because he’s always fiddling with his phone at night to find the time. He has said many times how much he loves just glancing up and he can see the time without his glasses! I spend more money for another brand one this one works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Ginger Alansky

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great, wouldn't change much
customer_reviews.text: The brightest setting is way too bright and even the dimmer setting is still pretty bright for my liking. I usually keep the screen off at bed time & use the projector. I do wish I could enlarge the projector display tho. It will get bigger but only if I position it further away. I like that I can set the alarm for individual days, weekdays, full weeks, or just weekends. I do like that when the alarm goes off the display lights up too. Also, if the power goes out the clock doesn't due to a backup battery. Plus it updates with daily savings which is great.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Performs as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: This clock radio does everything I'd want, with the following notes of interest. The ceiling time projection is nice. I once had another device that did that, but not nearly as well as this one. The speaker fidelity is not that great, making it not worth it to plug my phone into it to play music. Besides, anything plugged in to the AUX jack disables the radio, so I cannot go to sleep with my favorite music and wake up to news. Finally, the AM reception is not good: a lot of hum. One other really good thing is that I don't have to set the time. It figures that out. (NOTE: IT ONLY "KNOWS" NORTH AMERICAN TIME ZONES.)
customer_reviews.author: Jim H

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT TRUST THIS CLOCK!
customer_reviews.text: This clock is advertised to automatically adjust to daylight saving time. IT DOES NOT CHANGE! It should have changed during last night. It did not . Now it is an hour behind. No instructions on how to fix that. It is past the return period. Also you cannot adjust the projection, so it projects on the ceiling upside down. Even the dim setting lights up the room. I would NOT RECOMMEND THIS CLOCK.
customer_reviews.author: Su Z Q Z

customer_reviews.title: Awesome clock; ...NOT
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It has a super cool look to it. Displays a very readable time on ceiling or wall. It pretty much sets itself up. I don’t use temp or sleep mode. >Update I bought this clock in June 2019. I loved it as mentioned above. After 6 months I noticed that it is harder and harder to read the time. The numbers are fading into the background. What a disappointment. I really liked it. Maybe it's a bad one. The projection characters are rather jagged and hard to read so it's not a good projection clock either.
customer_reviews.author: HomeCoder

customer_reviews.title: Still looking for the perfect projection clock.
customer_reviews.text: We own this and one of the Sony "cube" shape projector clocks. On the plus side, this is half the price of the Sony. On the down side, the Sony projection is MUCH crisper. My wife has to guess what this says.. she can easily see the Sony. But as mentioned before it is half the price of the Sony, so if you have good vision (as I do), this will be fine. The one fatal flaw of the Sony is that the projection "expires" every 24(?) hours.. you have to remember to press the button every night. Thankfully this clock didn't include that "feature".
customer_reviews.author: M. Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong after 5 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this alarm clock almost five years ago, and it's still going strong! I appreciate the auto time set feature- helps a lot when the power goes out. Selecting the settings were a little confusing at first, but after getting used to it, they're no problem. The radio alarm starts off quiet and then increases to the volume you set for a gentle wake-up. The buzzer is sufficiently loud to wake me up, and I'm a heavy sleeper. Great value and durability!
customer_reviews.author: Budget Queen

customer_reviews.title: Good clock but projections won't work in less than a year.
customer_reviews.text: This clock has very nice functions but is complicated to use. It's a learning curve do how to operate the alarm clock but once you get it, you would like it. This is my second projection clock and the projector stopped working in less than a year: shows a wrong time that couldn't be changed and later won't display right. Seems like this kind if projection clock has a short life or maybe that's why they ask you to buy the protection plan... I will try a different product.
customer_reviews.author: melanie

customer_reviews.title: Good clock
customer_reviews.text: Rating based on clock/temperature and projection features. Good and accurate clock and temperature indoor and outdoor readings - just did not like it because there is no way to dim the LED clock all the way (4 stars). As far as the projection is concerned I would give it 5 stars in the beginning and now 1 star since the projection stopped working properly (became blurry) after 8 months. No rating on the radio since I have not used that feature often enough to properly access it's merits. Hence the 2.5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Zoltare

customer_reviews.title: Clock runs slow
customer_reviews.text: Yes it does project the time which is what I wanted. What I also wanted was a clock that kept the correct time. This clock loses a little over one minute per month. I reset the clock at the beginning of January (yet again) and set it one minute ahead. Now six months later it has lost seven minutes and I will have to reset it again. This is not something that I want to keep doing. It is annoying having to remember how much time it has lost and then add it to display to get the correct time.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ackman

customer_reviews.title: Good clock for those who want projection on the ceiling for time.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband to replace another clock we had that projected the time on the ceiling and also auto reset after power failure. He does like the clock but we both agree that we wish the projection time was bigger like our old clock since we both wear glasses. He likes that the radio tunes better than the older clock as well and he can set it to "military" time as well. I think the only other thing he wishes is that tie buttons for setting the alarms was bigger so it would be easier for him to set and turn off. Would buy again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Music & Book Fan

customer_reviews.title: This clock has worked out great..
customer_reviews.text: This clock has worked out great...programming is tricky first time but easy once hang of. Like the two alarms with the "days" programming. Only knock it for not having a "nap" setting so can sneak in an extra hour on a Saturday afternoon. It is bright, even on low setting. I don't point it right at me and so doesn't bother me but bright as a night light. Heavy feel for its size so not easily knocked off and easy to tap off switch at top.
customer_reviews.author: D. DawsonTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Features don't work
customer_reviews.text: The channel presets don't work. I tried setting preset channels the way the instructions read (which doesn't work and leaves some questions) and then I tried to preset the channels 2 other ways. I can only get one channel (out of 20) to preset and I have no idea why that one worked. The alarm set is probably also not working since I tried to set Alarm #2 to work by radio "wake-up" and it worked by the "alarm sound".
customer_reviews.author: Barbara B.

customer_reviews.title: but for people with different needs each day this is a terrible choice. I love the projection of the time ...
customer_reviews.text: Are you kidding me?!?! There is no way to set the alarm manually for a time for tomorrow morning. You can set for M-F or individually for each day of the week, but for people with different needs each day this is a terrible choice. I love the projection of the time on the ceiling, but I cannot set the damn alarm. I get up at different times depending on my work schedule. IMPOSSIBLE choice for me. Returning it if possible, if not will throw away. Might be Amazon's Choice, but certainly NOT mine. Any alarm should be able to be set for manual use easily.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Denise

customer_reviews.title: you have to read the instructions, it's a clock radio?
customer_reviews.text: All I was looking for was a simple clock radio. One that played music when the alarm sounds. which this one does. The music starts out with a low volume and then slowing increasing to your set point. my old clock had a AM/FM button. it had a dial to find the stations. not so much with this one. you need to read the included sheet to know how to do virtually everything. it works.
customer_reviews.author: Lee A. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: A great clock
customer_reviews.text: It is a a great clock. Seems to keep good time. I love the time on the ceiling at night. It was not too difficult to get set and started. However, if you are getting it for an alarm clock, think again. The alarm goes off, but very softly. If you are more than a few feet away it probably would not wake you, maybe not even then. For some reason I have had a hard time getting a loud alarm clock. Does anyone know why this is?
customer_reviews.author: June Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted - just 18 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 1.5 years with no problems, and then suddenly there is no visible display but the alarm went off at a wonky time (3:45 am, which is definitely NOT what I set). What I liked while it worked: I liked the dual alarms. Display was a bit brighter than I'd like, but I bought some dimming strips and took care of it. Disappointed that this alarm clock only lasted 18 months though, especially when the dual alarm clock it replaced had lasted 15 years.
customer_reviews.author: aunt-fuzzy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for a projection clock
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t use the radio for this, so I can’t speak to that. But I’ve had this clock for three years and it has been great. The only issue I have now is that the High Low brightness is a huge difference. I wish there was a medium because the screen is too bright at night on High, and unreadable at low. But the time projection is great, no issues. The only other thing I’ve noticed is that sometimes the time slowly changes, so then it is a few minutes behind.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Radio broke 2 times
customer_reviews.text: The first time I bought this, the radio stopped working after some months. After some coaxing, the seller agreed to send me a replacement. With the second one, the radio also quit working after some months. Admittedly I use the radio a lot, it can be left on all day, but I never had such a problem with other radios. There are many other nice clock radios, similar to this one. I'd suggest trying one of those.
customer_reviews.author: J. Guenther

customer_reviews.title: Not Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Does not keep accurate time. With today's technology, making a clock that will not keep time somewhat accurately is not acceptable. Ceiling projection is limited. The projection digits are 7 segment digits and sometimes you have to look closely to figure out what time it is. When the ceiling projector is in a good position it's pointing away from the bed and the face of the clock cannot be seen. The face light brightness options are either too dark or way too bright. If had known this, I would not have purchased this clock.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 18 months.
customer_reviews.text: It was great while it lasted. I never used the radio or the alarm (I use my phone for that) but the temp and display were nice. The projection was a little fuzzy even after dialing it in. But then I noticed it started getting slow. Everyday by a minute or so, then tonight it just stopped. Display screen shows nothing (but is still lit) and the projection is showing the same time hours later. It was an inexpensive purchase, but I was hoping it would last a bit longer than this!
customer_reviews.author: K. McPhail

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't keep accurate time...disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this clock except for the fact that the time is not accurate. It is 4 minutes off from the correct time according to my iPhone and Alexa. 4 minutes slow. After reading the one star reviews (unfortunately I read those AFTER I ordered the clock) I realized that this is a known problem, possibly due to the fact that the time is factory set and the clock isn't atomic. I will most likely be returning this clock, incorrect time is a deal breaker for me. Projection works nicely, I was able to program both alarms by following the instructions. Radio sound is a bit tinny but to be expected as this is a small radio.
customer_reviews.author: E J  Swartz

customer_reviews.title: Almost exactly what we needed.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little clock with all of the features we wanted and one drawback that we didn't realize needed to be a thing: Pros: - Brightness settings for the clock face - Projection has a 'flip' button in case you are projecting onto the ceiling and your bed orientation requires it. - Auto-set clock. Plug in and it fetches the correct date/time. - Multi-setting alarm (1-day/anyday, weekdays, weekends, etc.) Cons: The volume is SO low. This could not function as an alarm clock for anyone but the very lightest of sleepers.
customer_reviews.author: Mass Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Best alarm ever
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up! I love that the display has a dimmer for sleeping! It can be made very bright! Two alarms can be set for weekdays weekends or one time setting! It shows temperature, and has daylight savings time and ir comes with battery! Best of all the time projection on wall or ceilings makes it easy! It has buzzer, am or fm all increase in volume as alarm! FM reception not to great in my area but am and buzzer work great! I bought one first and another for second bedroom! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Compact Alarm Clock For A Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: I find comfort, in the fact, that you can set 2 different alarms. It's easy to go from one alarm setting to the second. I like the time projection ( you can direct it to a wall, door, or ceiling above ). It has crisp sounds from the FM radio. It's great that you can dim the face screen, so, you don't have a bright Blue Light blinding you from sleeping. So far, this is an awesome investment. The only thing, I don't like, is the alarm only last 30 minutes (my old alarm was 2-1/2hrs). Each "snooze" is 9 minutes long. (3 is all you get).
customer_reviews.author: CLAYTON GUIDRY

customer_reviews.title: Greatest clock ever
customer_reviews.text: So my wife and I both have a habit of waking up throughout the night to check the time. We had been using our cell phones and we'd have to pretty much wake up, rollover and take a look from the nightstand. Not the biggest deal in the world, but it did interrupt sleep patterns more. We bought this alarm clock and we project the time on the wall at the foot of the bed. it's not too bright at all, but the numbers are pretty huge on the projection and all we have to do is barely open one eye lid and see the time without moving and go back to sleep. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: G. Warren

customer_reviews.title: Projection isn't great
customer_reviews.text: The actual physical clock is great, very easy to set-up, use and even see - great to have different brightness options. The one problem is that the time projection on the wall is hard to read as it's very broken up and isn't made up of solid numbers as the picture indicates. The lines aren't close enough to make it easily read. Wish the lines were closer together and more readable like the previous projection clock I owned.
customer_reviews.author: MindblowingSports

customer_reviews.title: Like it enough to order another as a gift.
customer_reviews.text: Both the front and ceiling display are easy to read, and after dimming the main display, not so bright to bother me. The AM radio comes in much more clearly than the one it replaces. The addition of the thermometer on the screen with the clock gives a chance to address one of those recurring questions; did I wake up because the room is too hot/cold? My only complaint is that I doubt I would have figured out setting the alarm without the instructions, but perhaps that is just because it's new to me. Wasn't particularly difficult, probably just different than I'm used to.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't keep time
customer_reviews.text: It's nifty that it can pull time out of the air. It's less nifty that the time it grabs is incorrect. The set up process almost required a degree in engineering. Don't think you'll be able to plug it in, set it up and go to sleep within 5 minutes. You HAVE TO read the manual. That said, once you figure it out, it's not too difficult to reset the alarm. I'm returning it because it's lost over 10 minutes in the 3 weeks I've had it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT replacement!
customer_reviews.text: Clock came in on time, just in time, as my old projection clock was burning out segments of the projected numbers. I plugged it in and set every setting as per included, easy to understand, instructions. Even the radio ( I only listen to FM) played some beautiful music, and when I tested the projection clock, it was perfect right out of the box. I know I am going to really enjoy this great clock/ radio.
customer_reviews.author: Old Salt

customer_reviews.title: WAY TOO BRIGHT
customer_reviews.text: ABSURDLY TOO BRIGHT. So you can keep it in screen off mode which is what I do and I just use the projector to project the time on the ceiling. Works fine like that. The radio is lack luster. The temperature gauge is nice but you gotta have the screen on for that. I little more complicated to set up than is really necessary. And even if you have the screen off there is an indicator light that is on that is blinding when you are trying to sleep so I just had to cover it up with electrical tape.
customer_reviews.author: Siriss Toth

customer_reviews.title: I would buy it again
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this product. It has everything I wanted. The sound is excellent, I like the 2 settings on the readout, surprised to have a temperature reading, and there was no need to adjust time setting. I am not up on technology but this was surprisingly easy to start up. I am able to look at the ceiling during the night for the time, I like the 2 alarm setting for weekend times as well as weekday settings. Very impressed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: MaryAnn

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this clock!  Love the temp feature.
customer_reviews.text: Great clock! bouth this one for my son. Love the projection option and has ability to focus for shorter or longer distance. Love the dimmer that will offer it to be completely off. A little difficult to figure out the alarm setting, but then I kind of tried it without directions :) Great features on alarm for m-f, sat/sun or a single day. Was really hoping to find a clock with a daily alarm feature, where you could set each day differently, but I have yet to locate one other than the use of a cell phone. This one has been great alternative! Bought another model for myself Electrohome USB Charging Alarm and have been just as happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Complicated, but works when you figure it out
customer_reviews.text: It certainly is not intuitive on how this works, but when you get the hang of it, it works. It's not easy to set the alarm, but sooner or later I'll get it right the first time I try it. The sound quality is good, particularly the am band which isn't on other brands. I never thought the idea that the time projects on the ceiling was something I'd use, but actually it's kind of fun to look up without turning one's head to see what time it is. Bottom line - good product, but unnecessarily complex. But I assume I'll use it for years so can put up with the learning curve to work it.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzdrums

customer_reviews.title: Solid quality, cheap price
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked at the high quality of this item. Especially given the low price. At first I was unhappy at how bright the face of the clock is, but you can dim it with the little snooze button and then it stays dim. The only con was that it was a little larger and heavier than expected. I still fits on my narrow bookshelf headboard, though. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: courteous

customer_reviews.title: Blessed darkness!
customer_reviews.text: My primary requirement was that it could leave my room pitch dark which this does fine by being able to hit the snooze button to cycle through turning the clock bright, dim, and off altogether. I have no need for projection so just keep that off. The alarm settings could be designed better but I'll get used to it, and the alarm sound is a modern ding ding rather than the old style beep beep screech I'd prefer. I'll eventually replace this with the $80but this is fine for now, the best deal in it's class.
customer_reviews.author: aerich

customer_reviews.title: love this clock
customer_reviews.text: We stayed at a hotel in Arizona that had this clock or one like it. I like how the time shows on the ceiling. When we got home, we found this on Amazon and ordered it. It is hard to find good clock radio's when everyone uses their cell. So happy with this purchase. It was easy to set up - like the fact you can set the alarm for M-F. This way I don't have to remember to turn it off for the weekend and / or remember to turn it back on Sunday to go off for Monday.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really liked this alarm clock now I am really disappointed that ...
customer_reviews.text: Radio died... I should have listened to all of the people saying this. I really liked this alarm clock now I am really disappointed that I spent the money on it. I should have bought a cheap one at Walmart. It would have been more reliable and dependable.
customer_reviews.author: NU

customer_reviews.title: It's terrible!
customer_reviews.text: Since when does it take a doctorate to try to use an alarm clock? I realize that I'm not the most technological genius, but this is ridiculous. I tried for over an hour just to program my alarm, and still didn't get it accomplished. All I need is something to wake me up in the morning. I don't need to know the temp in my bedroom and the date, and whatever else is on it.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Lots of potential but cannot use it!
customer_reviews.text: This clock has potential but we cannot use it. The clock has a nice large face and can be seen from quite a distance away. There are some shortcomings, however, which makes this product unusable. First the directions make no sense. Neither I nor my wife can figure them out. They need to hire someone else to write the instructions. Second the clock needs to dim down one more level. Even at the lowest dim down level it floods the room with light. Studies say that light affects sleep. We stuck the clock in a box in the attic as we cannot use it and cannot get the alarm to stay off.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Ponder

customer_reviews.title: Only the time is projected on the wall.
customer_reviews.text: I like that I don't have to have the clock turned directly to me to see what time it is. I can see the time projected on the wall. I also love that the projector is attached to the clock and it shows the temperature in the room, the day of the week and it automatically changes to daylight saving time. It's a great clock. It doesn't take up a lot of room on my night stand because it's small. I love this clock.
customer_reviews.author: Grannygil

customer_reviews.title: However Sound quality is very poor Volume control at the 01 setting is relatively loud
customer_reviews.text: You do not even get what you paid for ! Chose it because of the AM /FM digital radio, However Sound quality is very poor Volume control at the 01 setting is relatively loud. when setting as a pre-sleep setting, it will keep you up. and the wake up morning radio Alarm - will certainly get you out of bed. "programming" is less than friendly and intuitive. When plugging anything - ( an I phone to be charged) into the same power strip there is a strong buzzing and humming sound. so much for the digital sound quality. This one is going back!
customer_reviews.author: Arie Kepets

customer_reviews.title: Love the projection
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this clock. We purchased it mainly for the projection. The farther you direct the projection the larger the projected time will be. Now I do not need to sit up and look over at the clock on the other side of the bed. I can just look straight ahead. As for the other functions, I only set up the clock as instructed and everything seemed to work fine. The projection has made a huge difference to me as I wake up often during the night and can see the time easily and clearly.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure if I would like the time projection feature but I do, I love it. The radio of this product works very well, clear sound and great audio transmission. It even tuned into a station I like that most other clock radios haven't been able to tune into. I really like the way this clock is designed for the dual alarms. Extremely easy to set up and adjust without being a pain to do. The unit data display is very bright and clear, easy to read the information displayed. I am very happy with this product and how it works. Really glad I bought this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't for me
customer_reviews.text: The many buttons on the user interface were a nightmare for me. The buttons have multiple functions depending on whatever. Even their roadmap listing functions goes into the teens. There are buttons on back, top and front. It has more buttons than grandpa's underwear.. I live in a hillside home and reception was spotty for some stations I listen too.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Started out decent, then went downhill
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap. It displays the date, time, and temperature. It can even project the time on a wall. It has a radio. It has battery backup. Quibbles: 1. There are three brightness settings: bright, moderate, and off. I found moderate annoyingly bright for overnight use; I had to buy some light dimming plastic to reduce the intensity. 2. As implied online, the projection arm doesn't allow aiming downward. In my case, a 10 or 20 degree downward angle would have been very helpful. ***UPDATE Dec 2018: the display has dimmed a lot! The "moderate setting" is now the same as off -- not visible even in the dark. The "bright" setting is marginally visible in a lit room.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Solid alarm clock, but some learning required.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, a solid alarm clock, with a pretty cool projection feature. The projection is the perfect brightness to show up at night, but you won't see it during the day. However, it's not the simplest alarm clock to operate, and you WILL NEED to read and understand the manual. It has a lot of options, which I like, but they aren't presented in a way that's immediately obvious what they do. Before I read the manual, and practiced using the options, I accidentally left the alarm off, and was late to work. I would recommend it, but only to people willing to RTFM (Read The Fine Manual).
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas J. Hertzler

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work in Eurpoe
customer_reviews.text: It seems like a decent product, it's just hard to notice that it is not gonna work at 220V, as is in EU. Most of the electronics these days have both 110v and 220v compatibility, but this one doesn't, so it should be somehow pointed out to the costumers very clearly. I called the producer (in Canada), they said they don't even produce it for 220 voltage, only 110-120, so for me this was waste of money (when I was back to EU, I missed the return window).
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Alarm turns off on its own, very quickly
customer_reviews.text: The clock is pretty good, and my daughter *loves* the radio. The only problem is that if you don't set it to wake to the radio, the buzzer beeps for about 30-45 seconds, then turns off on its own. Unfortunately, my daughter doesn't wake up to that (despite it being pretty loud), and it just turns itself off and doesn't beep again until the next day. So, if you are a light-ish sleeper, or get up easily in the morning, this could be great for you. For us, it doesn't work well... I may end up switching it to my son's room, since he is a lighter sleeper.
customer_reviews.author: TuxGirl

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and use. The radio works well. I live in a poor reception area and it pulls in a number of good stations clearly. I have two complaints. One, even on low the display is brighter than I would like. It doesn't keep me awake but could be a problem for some. I've been using it with the display off and the projection on which brings me to complaint #2. When a number displays that doesn't require the top or bottom to be illuminated, the number displays as a smaller size and is difficult to read. This is not an atomic clock. Any reference to auto time set is referring to the battery back up.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Austin

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the clock or temp numbers being able to go on the ceiling or wall! Makes it easier when you are just lying in bed and can't seem to sleep. You don't have to keep checking the clock or your phone to see what time it is. You just look up and there it is. Recommendations: Eastern time was a few minutes off and I had to manually set it, however. I wish the clock light could be dimmed. Lights up the whole room.
customer_reviews.author: vicky cates

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE my projection clock
customer_reviews.text: When I'm laying in bed at night and need to know the time, I don't even have to sit up & find a clock. It's right there on the ceiling! It's not too bright, so it doesn't disturb my sleep. Big enough I can make out the numbers without my glasses. The display on the front of the clock can be darkened very easily also so it doesn't disturb your sleep at night.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Ok, But Beware
customer_reviews.text: Display is very bright, but the projected time is not bright enough for my taste. A great feature is you can flip flop the time display if you are aiming it at the ceiling. Meaning, depending on which way you lay you can read it properly and not upside down. The instructions are horrible so be prepared to learn how to use it on your own. Beware: There is English and Spanish written on the clock. In addition, I can't figure out how to change the Temp to F and not C.
customer_reviews.author: h

customer_reviews.title: Projection image hard to read
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a replacement for a different brand that was giving me problems. Features are nice. Set up easy. BUT, the projection image is a problem. I use a projector because I am near-sighted and want to be able to see the time when in bed, without glasses. The projected image is very small, which is difficult but might be tolerable. But, the image is made of small bars of light with large separation between them; it is extremely hard to read the display when what you see if a bunch of "blobs" of light with large spaces between them. The developers must all have 20-20 vision without correction. I have decided to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Beanland

customer_reviews.title: Not very bright or large on the ceiling.
customer_reviews.text: It isn’t very bright. So, there’s that. Also, the projection, isn’t very large. It’s kind of small to be projected up on the ceiling. It works like it’s supposed to. So these things just bother me. Easy to read numbers- hmmm. It’s kind of old timey so yes you can read it. But, there are better quality alarm clock projections that I should of considered.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Clock
customer_reviews.text: Have had this clock for about two weeks & I love it. It replaced a similar one I had received as a gift many years ago that I have been trying to replace. I love the 180 feature that allows you to see the projected time at the correct orientation (other ones I had bought were upside down when viewing them while laying in bed). I also like the dimming feature which allows me turn the face of the clock off during nighttime.
customer_reviews.author: BA

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the single best alarm clock I have ever owned. It projects the time onnour ceiling, soft reddish orange light, that does not wake you up. There are 2 alarms. Which is perfect for my husband and I. The buttons are easy to use and the "fade in" of the sound is fantastic, since some mornings I wake just before the alarm and the light comes on first before the sound and I can turn it off without waking my husband.
customer_reviews.author: Plant Based Karen

customer_reviews.title: Useful projection clock
customer_reviews.text: Lately If I wake up middle of the night , I use my phone to check the time. But I get distracted if there are any messages on the lock screen. Saw this clock in my friends home and ordered right away. We can adjust brightness of the screen and projection on the ceiling bright enough to read at night. No more using phone in the middle of the night.
customer_reviews.author: cool boy

customer_reviews.title: Questions, questions.
customer_reviews.text: I have not used all the functions on this clock so I cannot give a higher rating. My prime reason for buying this item is the projection feature, which I like, and battery back-up. The battery back-up function was not clearly explained in the description and is not really addressed in the user's instructions, only that it uses a specific battery number. What's not really clear about the battery back-up is, "does it maintain the time set and is there an indication of when the battery needs to be replaced "?
customer_reviews.author: Okieboy

customer_reviews.title: Worst radio sound ever.
customer_reviews.text: I like most of the alarm clock. I really like the display and projection, however, there are two reasons why I will probably send it back. First, the alarm only goes off for 30 minutes and there is no way to change this. I enjoy listening to the radio in the morning and 30 minutes is just not long enough. Second, and probably the fatal flaw is the sound quality. The sound is awful and very crackly. It sounds worse than any alarm clock radio I have ever owned! For a clock and thermometer, this is great. For a radio, it is the worst.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Radio quit working in less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Everything was going well for a few weeks and I was ready to give it 4 or 5 stars. The unit seemed to be as well made as I expected. I only gave the sound quality 2 stars in case someone was expecting great sound it was actually as I expected. However, the radio just quit working. I have not tried the buzzer but I hate being awakened by a buzzer. I have also thrown out the packing material so I guess if I hate the buzzer I'll have to throw the unit out and get something else from someone else.
customer_reviews.author: John Sprung

customer_reviews.title: Many features, not very user friendly/intuitive
customer_reviews.text: This clock radio has many features, yet is not very intuitive to set up and use, there are codes for setting the volume for radio alarm mode and just turning off an alarm isn't easy once set up. The display is great, I like the temperature feature, I like knowing the temp in our bedroom. The display can be turned to a dim mode or completely off, which I like. It will do the job, but will take me time to remember all the codes and which buttons to use for the set ups.
customer_reviews.author: Jill M

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive clock radio
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6 year old son and he loved it. It is a good inexpensive clock radio for kids. The sound quality is decent but no great. While it wasn't that hard to set up there are definitely a couple features that are on higher quality radios that would have been nice like a scan button for the radio. My son likes the clock projection feature which he shines onto the ceiling above his bed.
customer_reviews.author: Craig J. M.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps time perfectly, even when the powers out
customer_reviews.text: Nice clock, didn't have to do much to get it working. Time was off by a few minutes but I fixed it and it hasn't been a problem since. Only complaint is that the projector isn't especially bright, even on the highest setting, so it's only useful at night. Still, it's overall well designed, looks good, and keeps time excellently even after power outages, which is why I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: I recently got this new radio alarm clock and I love it. It is a bit complicated to set up, but as I get used to it, it gets easier. I like that I can shut off the dimmer at night and turn it back on during the day and having the time reflected on the ceiling is a nice feature so that I don't have to turn around to check the time if I need to when I am in bed. Plus it is just the right size for my night table. Noelle
customer_reviews.author: Noelle

customer_reviews.title: 2 different times
customer_reviews.text: I needed: 1. Set 2 different times for wake-up on different work days. 2. 24h time set. 3. Snooze several times. 4. Hold settings during power outage. 5. Dim or turn off the LSD. All those requirements are met. The workout for #1: Set for 1-5 workdays two alarms - 1 and 2 on different time. Turn on/off alarm 1/2 (one button push) at night. It even has a short nap mode.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Very complicated to set time, alarm, radio or alarm only.
customer_reviews.text: This is THE most complicated clock to set. It is so complicated even when following the instructions to a tee. I've had it for 6 months and hate it. I finally bought a new alarm clock today to replace it. The only thing that is nice about it is that you have the options of having the alarm go off Mon-Fri or Sunday-Sunday. Still not worth all the frustration. Hopefully the new one will be easy to set.
customer_reviews.author: JSF - SF

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to use and my 14 year old set it up and I originally bought it because it has dual alarms, and also he doesn't have to remember to keep setting it every night and if he needs to get up on the weekend or summer he doesn't have to mess with his school alarm he can use the other one. Plus the projection time he set for the ceiling right over his bed.
customer_reviews.author: jerriwatts

customer_reviews.title: The high ratings puzzle me.  Difficult to operate.
customer_reviews.text: It works, but very difficult to set up. With exploration, can be figured out. Insrtuction manual lacks crucial instructions. A initial appreciation of this device's display and temperature features was overshadowed by difficulty in reprogramming after apparently hitting wrong buttons during snooze phase several times. Lots of little buttons to accidentally hit, perhaps. I wake up carefully and deliberately because of this alarm clock. Bought one of these as a gift during my initial infatuation with the device but recipient threw it away after three months due to frustration with ability to set the device.
customer_reviews.author: ScottsdaleAZ

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great projection
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this clock to replace a more expensive one that I threw away in frustration. THAT one was so un-intuitive that I spent close to an hour trying to put the thing back to standard time after daylight savings. And it was supposed to be self-setting! GRRRRRR This clock set itself to the correct time and date almost immediately after I chose the correct time zone. It was an easy to understand procedure, and the projection works great! My only complaint is that the text on the clock is dark and small, and the clock body is black. It is very difficult to read "the fine print!"
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love the "time on ceiling feature"
customer_reviews.text: Had been shopping for a new alarm clock for a while.... gave 4 stars as I have not tried out the alarm feature as yet. It was easy to set up, display is well illuminated, love the time on the ceiling as I wake often in the night to see what time it is. Like it as its small enough not to take up too much room on my nightstand. A I am British I love the 24 hour clock display and have it set to this.
customer_reviews.author: KERRY LARSON

customer_reviews.title: I love this clock!
customer_reviews.text: I can't imagine ever going back to looking at a regular clock at night on my nightstand when this projects the time on the ceiling. I wake up a lot at night, and for some reason feel compelled to know what time it is. With this clock I just look up and the time is on the ceiling, easy to read. And it is not too bright as to be distracting when trying to sleep. Really Great.
customer_reviews.author: mauiken

customer_reviews.title: Great Radio/Alarm Clock
customer_reviews.text: I love the projection alarm clock radio. It has so many features...projects time on the ceiling, dimming lights to allow total darkness except for the ceiling feature, two different alarm settings with multiple features. My only negative would be it has sooooo many features it takes awhile to learn how to use them all. That aside-the clock has almost everything you could ever think of at a great price. Quality seems excellent as well.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas D. Groom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love this because you can dim the screen all the way off. I like my room pitch black so I can’t stand the bright displays that clocks usually have. The red numbers on the ceiling are the perfect red dim light that my old clock had before it broke. I always had to cover the screen on that one, so I’m happier with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: How to set the darn thing!
customer_reviews.text: Total dislike. I spent 2 hours and finally unplugged it and there's no battery backup. So if I figure it out in the dining room, when I unplug it I have to start all over. Can't change the time zone once I entered the wrong one... can't set the time, but I did see that it was automatically done for me after much research. The instructions are poor........ should I continue? Hopefully, my young neighbor can break the code for me! Otherwise..... you get it back.
customer_reviews.author: P. L. Frishett

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistency seems to be the theme of reviews
customer_reviews.text: Most of the features are fine for an inexpensive clock: visibility is good, my son likes the projection feature and it was easy to set alarm. However the volume at the lowest level is so loud we can hear it through our entire house - not what you want to wake up to and I don't think we can bear to keep using it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan's mom

customer_reviews.title: Decent alarm clock
customer_reviews.text: I have had this alarm clock for 3 1/2 years now, unfortunately as of this morning it has died suddenly. The clock just suddenly switched to the pictured display and no longer works. Fairly disappointing since my last alarm clock lasted almost 10 years, still I guess 3 1/2 years is a decent run. Overall a decent alarm clock, albeit minimal features regarding what days to set your alarm clock for (weekends, weekdays, or a single day and only 2 alarms). I liked the roof laser display and thought it was a nice feature that functioned well. Never used the radio very much so can't really comment on the quality of that.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley A. Najarro

customer_reviews.title: Won't last forever
customer_reviews.text: About a year into owning the product, the lense or projector basically failed. I loved it while it worked, but it should generally last longer than one year. I also found the clock setup to be overly complicated and not worth the effort given I have other sources for an alarm. I honestly wish they just made a simpler device that just put out the projection and nothing else involved.
customer_reviews.author: Mirrorsaw

customer_reviews.title: Some complain about the brightness of the backlight. It ...
customer_reviews.text: Some complain about the brightness of the backlight. It is not bright enough to bother me and makes a small glow so I don't need to turn on any lights to see well enough to get to the bathroom without hurting my shins. Or I can turn it up and see quite well. The remote display works well so I can see the time on the ceiling by just cracking an eye open rather than lifting my head to see the clock. I do not use the radio or alarm as I am retired and it is very hard to pick up anything on a radio where I live without an exterior antennae.
customer_reviews.author: Mike J

customer_reviews.title: Way too loud...
customer_reviews.text: This clock (Electrohome Projection Alarm Clock with AM/FM Radio, Battery Backup, Auto Time Set, Dual Alarm) is really, really nice if you don't sleep next to a person who plays the radio to fall asleep! If you do, be prepared. The volume only turns down so far and then becomes mute; unfortunately, the lowest volume isn't low enough! I actually had to purchase a different clock radio so my husband had better volume control.
customer_reviews.author: Linda L

customer_reviews.title: Time to get rid of my 20 + year old clock
customer_reviews.text: I have been running in tandem my old clock and this new one (just to make sure it would work). It does. I am retiring my Panasonic with CD player (yes, a college purchase in the early 90s). Features I like: weekend setting, dual alarm and I am getting used to the projection of time on the ceiling (or wherever you choose). Feature I do not like: I have a metal side table, the static without a buffer (due to the antenna). Oh well! Still keeping!
customer_reviews.author: S F C from NJ

customer_reviews.title: Sets to be 13 minutes late
customer_reviews.text: The clock automatically sets to be about 13 minutes late, cannot be reset and comes with no manual. In the trash!
customer_reviews.author: Anya

product_meta.title: Magnasonic Projection Alarm Clock with AM/FM Radio, Battery Backup, Auto Time Set, Dual Alarm & 3.5mm Audio Input (EAAC601)
product_meta.description:
Color:Black BodyConvenience, reliability, & modern design come in the form of the EAAC601 Projection Alarm clock by Electrohome. This advanced clock radio automatically sets the time and date and saves all your alarm settings when the power goes out. Plus, with time projection display, dual alarms, temperature display, a large backlit LCD with dimming options, and the ability to play your smartphone, tablet, or MP3 player music, this is the only alarm clock you’ll ever need.

View the time/date & temperature clearly on the large 3.6” blue display. The dimmer options (high, low, off) let you reduce the screen’s brightness for those sensitive to light and the auto dimmer feature will disable the screen completely for night time use. This alarm clock also displays the indoor temperature (C/F) and the current day/month/year.

Project the time on your ceiling or wall, so it will always be in full view from anywhere in the room even when you are lying in bed. This feature also allows you to tilt a full 180 degrees, so you can project the time or even the temperature. The adjustable focus allows the projected time to always remain crystal clear.

This smart alarm clock is preconfigured with the correct time, all you need to do is specify your time zone and it will always be accurate, even after a power outage.

Long lasting battery backup restores your alarm settings and automatically adjusts for daylight savings time.

Set two separate wake times with the dual alarm feature for you and your partner. You can also choose to automatically disable the alarms on weekends, allowing both of you to set your alarm schedule once! and forget it!

Listen to your favorite music using your iPhone, iPad, or Android device through the 3.5mm AUX audio input or using the built-in digital AM/FM radio with 20 station memory.

Wake to your favorite radio station, or the built-in buzzer.This unit also has snooze, sleep, and nap functions.
feature_bullets: Feature-rich alarm clock radio that offers a large, crystal clear 3.6" blue LCD display that can be dimmed to adjust to your brightness preference
Project time or even temperature onto your walls or ceiling so that the time will always be in full view. 180-degree swivel projection means you'll never have to roll over to view the time again.
Automatically adjusts to Daylight Savings Time & includes pre-programmable daily dual alarm option with weekend cancellation for you and your partner - wake to radio, buzzer, time projection
Listen to your favorite music using your iPhone, iPad, Android, or MP3 device through the 3.5mm AUX input or using the built in AM/FM radio with digital tuning
Advanced SelfSet technology automatically displays the correct time/date and this clock even restores alarm settings after power loss (built-in Lithium battery)
